definition: Cang Jize or Tseng Chi-tse (1839-1890), pioneer diplomat of late Qing, serve as imperial commissioner (ambassador) to UK, France and Russia
great- (grandfather, grandchild etc)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
surname Zeng
surname Ji/also pr. [Ji4]
order/discipline/age/era/period/to chronicle

sentences.english: Part There evaluates Zeng's view on the western culture.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分对曾纪泽西方文化观加以评价。

sentences.english: The third part expounds the limits and influence of Zeng s modern diplomatic ideas.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分论述了曾纪泽近代外交思想的局限和影响。

sentences.english: Part Two discusses the main content of Zeng Ji-ze's views on the western culture.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分评述曾纪泽西方文化观的主要内容。

definition: Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Xue Fucheng (1838-1894), Qing official and progressive political theorist
Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
Shen Baozhen (1820-1879), Qing Minister of the Navy, founded Fuzhou Naval College 船政學堂|船政学堂[Chuan2 zheng4 Xue2 tang2] in 1866
Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Wu Tingfang (1842-1922), diplomat and lawyer
Zhang Yinhuan (1837-1900), late Qing politician and senior Chinese diplomat
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Grand Prince Yixin (1833-1898), sixth son of Emperor Daoguang, prominent politician, diplomat and modernizer in late Qing
Xu Jiyu (1795-1873), Chinese geographer
Huang Zunxian (1848-1905), Qing dynasty poet and diplomat, author of A Record of Japan 日本國誌|日本国志[Ri4 ben3 Guo2 zhi4], an extended analysis of Meiji Japan
Sir Thomas Francis Wade (1818-1895), British diplomat and sinologist, originator of the Wade-Giles Chinese romanization system
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
